But even while the labor market remains strong, there isn't much to celebrate in the foreseeable future. We could still very well find ourselves in a recession over the next 12 months, with limited economic growth and lower prospects for improvement in Americans' standard of living that could linger for the rest of the decade.

SUMMARY: In the past week, Ukrainian troops have dealt a huge blow to Russia's grip on parts of the east of their country with a fast-moving offensive. The stunning campaign has kicked off a new phase of the war and could force Vladimir Putin to reconsider his strategy and objectives.

TITLE: Analysis: The clock is ticking on a big threat to the US economy
SUMMARY: This Friday, tens of thousands of railroad workers are poised to go on strike, potentially bringing a nearly a third of all US freight to a grinding halt. It would be the first national rail strike in 30 years.

TITLE: Worst drought threatens the world's olive oil supply
Workers at two big British ports to strike later this month
SUMMARY: Workers at Britain's biggest container port Felixstowe plan to stage a second eight-day strike over pay, the Unite union said on Tuesday, adding to a wave of industrial unrest caused by soaring inflation.

TITLE: TikTok star shares her breastfeeding journey and excess milk to help others
SUMMARY: With no end in sight to the baby formula shortage, lifestyle content creator and new mom Lucie Fink is stepping up to help babies in need. She's donating her excess breast milk, and she credits her TikTok and Instagram followers with inspiring her to help.

TITLE: After 40 days in a bomb shelter, two Ukrainian refugees and 17 dogs are ready to start a new life in Poland
SUMMARY: When CNN Hero Aaron Jackson welcomed the first group of dogs from Ukraine to the abandoned animal shelter he's reopened in Poland, he also took in two refugees who shared an amazing story of survival.

TITLE: This CNN Hero solves an often invisible problem by providing 'Undies for Everyone'
SUMMARY: It's not every day you meet a rabbi from Texas with a thing for underwear.

TITLE: Russia has spent over $300 million on influencing foreign elections since 2014, US officials say
SUMMARY: Russia has covertly transferred over $300 million to foreign political parties around the globe since 2014, a senior Biden administration official said Tuesday, citing a review by the US intelligence community.

TITLE: Ports in eastern China at standstill as typhoon Muifa closes in
SUMMARY: Authorities in China's eastern province of Zhejiang ordered ships to return to port, told schools to close and evacuated tourists from nearby islands, as one of this year's strongest typhoons is set to make landfall on Wednesday.

TITLE: Architects propose surrounding world's tallest building with a giant ring
SUMMARY: In Dubai, experimental architecture firm ZNera Space has proposed a conceptual design featuring a massive five-story circular structure wrapped around the world's tallest skyscraper, the Burj Khalifa -- which towers at a staggering 829.8 meters (2,723 feet), almost double the height of the Empire State Building.

TITLE: Ceasefire is short-lived as Azerbaijan and Armenia resume attacks
SUMMARY: Despite earlier claims of a ceasefire, fighting between Azerbaijan and Armenia continued Wednesday, a day after nearly 100 soldiers died in clashes, according to the Azerbaijani and Armenian ministries of defense.

TITLE: South Korea issues arrest warrant for developer of failed cryptocurrency Luna
SUMMARY: A South Korean court has issued an arrest warrant for Do Kwon, the primary developer of cryptocurrencies Luna and TerraUSD, whose spectacular collapse in May roiled crypto markets around the world.

TITLE: A tropical depression in the Atlantic could become Tropical Storm Fiona
SUMMARY: Tropical Depression Seven formed in the Atlantic on Wednesday morning, the National Hurricane Center said in its 11 a.m. ET update -- and could become Tropical Storm Fiona later in the day or on Thursday.

TITLE: McDonald's is closing all its UK restaurants Monday for the Queen's funeral
SUMMARY: McDonald's roughly 1,200 locations across the United Kingdom will close for most of the day Monday for Queen Elizabeth's funeral.

TITLE: Opinion: Here's how to make it easier for workers to find better jobs
SUMMARY: Each day seems to bring new headlines of low-wage workers coming together to start a union. A historically tight labor market has given rise to a new era of worker power, although the conditions workers are protesting are far from new. Low wages, minimal benefits, hazardous working conditions and unpredictable schedules are the byproduct of trends that are decades in the making.

TITLE: Some good inflation news: Wholesale prices fell in August
SUMMARY: Just one day after August's disappointing Consumer Price Index report triggered a meltdown on Wall Street, a separate inflation report indicated that wholesale price increases are showing signs of improvement.

TITLE: UK McDonald's locations closed Monday for the Queen's funeral
SUMMARY: McDonald's roughly 1,200 locations across the United Kingdom will close for most of the day Monday for Queen Elizabeth's funeral.

TITLE: Fred Franzia, creator of Trader Joe's 'Two Buck Chuck,' has died
SUMMARY: Fred Franzia, the man behind "Two Buck Chuck" and other value-priced wines that revolutionized the industry, has died. He was 79.

TITLE: Good inflation news: Wholesale prices fell in August
SUMMARY: Just one day after August's disappointing Consumer Price Index report triggered a meltdown on Wall Street, a separate inflation report indicated that wholesale price increases are showing signs of improvement.

TITLE: Highlights from New York Fashion Week
SUMMARY: Fashion month returned to New York in a big way, with five-and-a-half-days of in-person runway shows including Gabriela Hearst, Prabal Gurung, LaQuan Smith, Collina Strada and Batsheva, hosted in iconic locations around the city.

TITLE: The hidden environmental toll of houseplants
SUMMARY: From lush, temperamental fiddle-leaf figs to laidback snake plants, indoor houseplants have become ubiquitous in the homes of many millennials and Gen Z -- particularly as their care became a soothing and serotonin-boosting hobby early in the pandemic.

TITLE: Senate panel advances bill to bolster US security assistance to Taiwan
SUMMARY: The Senate Foreign Relations Committee approved a bill to bolster US security assistance to Taiwan, authorizing $6.5 billion over the next five years.

TITLE: In Lebanon, armed customers rob banks to get their own money
SUMMARY: Two seemingly armed and desperate Lebanese depositors held up banks on Wednesday to force access to their own money, which has been blocked during a national financial meltdown.

TITLE: Xi and Putin want to create a new world order. Russia's setback in Ukraine could spoil their plans
SUMMARY: The last time Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin sat down face to face, they declared triumphantly the arrival of a "new era" in international relations.

TITLE: Indonesia, Brazil biggest culprits in tropical forest loss linked to industrial mining: study
SUMMARY: Industrial-scale mining for materials such as coal, gold, and iron ore is spurring tropical deforestation, with once-impenetrable forest cleared for mines and access roads, new research shows.

TITLE: Woman arrested in South Korea for the alleged murder of two children found in suitcases in New Zealand
SUMMARY: A 42-year-old woman believed to be the mother of two children whose remains were found in suitcases bought from a storage facility in New Zealand has been arrested for alleged murder in South Korea.

TITLE: Armenia reports ceasefire after new border clashes with Azerbaijan over Nagorno-Karabakh
SUMMARY: A senior Armenian official said late on Wednesday that a truce had been agreed with Azerbaijan after two days of violence linked to a decades-old dispute between the ex-Soviet states over the territory of Nagorno-Karabakh.

TITLE: 3 ways China and Russia are forging much closer economic ties
SUMMARY: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, will meet face-to-face this week for the first time since Moscow sent troops into Ukraine earlier this year.

TITLE: 'We are not here forever,' says UN as Haiti searches for path to election
SUMMARY: Mass protests. Lethal outbursts of gang warfare. An overwhelmed judiciary and a barren legislative branch where a handful of representatives linger among the vacant seats of former colleagues.

TITLE: Relief, but little joy, in one Ukrainian town liberated after Russian occupation
SUMMARY: Shevchenkove may have been liberated after more than six months of Russian occupation, but in the run-down streets of this small town in northeastern Ukraine, there are no scenes of joy.

TITLE: Canadian family taking world tour before children lose their vision
SUMMARY: Their daughter Mia was just three years old when Canadian couple Edith Lemay and Sebastien Pelletier first noticed that she was having vision problems.

TITLE: Analysis: The Queen's death has drawn the venom from Britain's toxic politics. Will it last?
SUMMARY: Liz Truss had only been prime minister of the United Kingdom for two days when she learned that Queen Elizabeth, the monarch who'd earlier that week asked her to form a government, was dead.

TITLE: US rail strike deal saves train commuters from a nightmare
SUMMARY: US commuter railroads and passengers are breathing a sigh of relief as freight rail companies and the unions that represent their workers averted a potential freight strike that would have crippled their services.

TITLE: McDonald's CEO sounds the alarm over crime in Chicago
SUMMARY: McDonald's CEO Chris Kempczinski has big concerns about surging crime in Chicago, where the fast food giant is based, saying it is impacting the company's restaurants and making it harder to recruit corporate talent.

TITLE: Spending rose in August as gas prices fell
SUMMARY: Another month of falling gas prices gave Americans' wallets a bit of a reprieve in August. That sent consumers back to stores last month.

TITLE: Ford's new Mustang sticks with pure gasoline
SUMMARY: Ford unveiled an all-new version of the two-door Mustang coupe at an event in Detroit Wednesday night. It has a new body design and new engine options, but the one thing it won't have is electric motors. The new Mustang will be offered only with pure gasoline power, at least for now. Buyers will just have to choose how much gasoline they want to burn to make how much power.

TITLE: Experts slam 'pittance' in aid to Pakistan as they find climate crisis played a role in floods
SUMMARY: An analysis of Pakistan's devastating floods has found "fingerprints" of the human-made climate crisis on the disaster, which killed more than 1,400 people and destroyed so much land and infrastructure it has plunged the South Asian nation into crisis.

TITLE: Retired Mexican general arrested over Ayotzinapa students who vanished in 2014
SUMMARY: Mexico has arrested retired army general José Rodríguez Pérez in relation to the bloody disappearance of 43 students in the city of Iguala, nearly eight years ago.

TITLE: Putin concedes China has 'questions and concerns' over Russia's faltering invasion of Ukraine
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday praised China's "balanced position" on the Ukraine war, though he conceded Beijing had "questions and concerns" over the invasion, in what appeared to be a veiled admission of their diverging views over the protracted military assault.

TITLE: 3 ways China and Russia are forging closer economic ties
SUMMARY: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, will meet face-to-face this week for the first time since Moscow sent troops into Ukraine earlier this year.

TITLE: Chinese and Russian militaries share a potential weakness, new US report finds
SUMMARY: China's military leaders share a potential weakness that has undermined their Russian counterparts in Ukraine and could hamper their ability to wage a similar war, according to a new report from the US National Defense University.

TITLE: What Britain looked like the last time a monarch died
SUMMARY: As the United Kingdom mourns Queen Elizabeth II, only a minority will remember first-hand what life was like the last time the country buried a monarch.

TITLE: China and Russia present united front at summit as Ukraine war risks exposing regional divisions
SUMMARY: When Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin sit down with other Asian leaders at a summit in Central Asia Friday, they will seek to present a united front to counterbalance the United States and its allies.

TITLE: British pound hits a 37-year low as UK economy skids
SUMMARY: The British pound slumped to a 37-year low on Friday after new data showed that shoppers are pulling back spending as inflation squeezes household budgets, underscoring fears that the economy may already be shrinking.

TITLE: FedEx cuts sales forecast by half a billion dollars, warning of economy
SUMMARY: FedEx shares plunged 21% in premarket trading Friday after it warned last Thursday that a slowing economy will cause it to fall $500 million short of its revenue target.

TITLE: Cheaper oil and Ukraine war are blowing a hole in Russia's finances
SUMMARY: There are new signs of strain in the Russian economy as energy prices fall and nearly seven months of war in Ukraine prove increasingly costly.

TITLE: Manchester United: Winning on Wall Street despite struggling on the field
SUMMARY: Fans of the Manchester United Football Club are not thrilled to see their squad in the middle of the pack of the English Premier League so far this season, especially after a disappointing run in 2021.

TITLE: Wall Street dodged a rail strike, but there's trouble ahead
SUMMARY: The announcement from the White House that a tentative deal has been reached to avert the first national rail strike in three decades comes as a huge relief for businesses and investors worried about fresh supply chain disruptions.

TITLE: Hungary can 'no longer be considered a full democracy,' says EU Parliament
SUMMARY: Hungary can "no longer be considered a full democracy," the European Parliament said in a statement following its adoption of a report on Thursday.

TITLE: Five banks in Lebanon held up by depositors demanding access to savings
SUMMARY: Depositors held up at least five separate banks around Lebanon on Friday in an attempt to retrieve savings frozen in the banking system, a Lebanese army official told CNN.

TITLE: Air traffic control strike grounds hundreds of flights across Europe
SUMMARY: Hundreds of flights have been canceled and thousands of passengers forced to change plans as French air traffic controllers took industrial action over pay on Friday.

TITLE: Major fire breaks out at 42-story skyscraper in Changsha, China
SUMMARY: A major fire broke out in a 42-story skyscraper in the central Chinese city of Changsha in Hunan province on Friday.

TITLE: She was only in Paris for three days. She met the love of her life on the Metro
SUMMARY: Andye was only in Paris for three days. On day one, she jumped aboard the Metro train that would change her life forever.

TITLE: Iran's Supreme Leader shown at event amid reports of deteriorating health
SUMMARY: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei was seen attending an event at a mosque in Tehran on Saturday, according to pictures and a video published on Iran's government websites and state media, one day after reports circulated about of his deteriorating health.

TITLE: 3.4 million children in Pakistan need 'immediate, lifesaving support' after floods: UNICEF
SUMMARY: "Super floods" in Pakistan have left 3.4 million children in need of "immediate, lifesaving support," according to UNICEF.

TITLE: Woman, 22, dies after falling into coma while in custody of Iran's morality police
SUMMARY: A 22-year-old Iranian woman has died after being arrested by Iran's morality police earlier this week, Iran's semi-official Etemad Online website reported, quoting her uncle.

TITLE: As Singapore mourns the Queen, there's little discussion about its colonial past
SUMMARY: It has been close to six decades since the British monarchy symbolically ruled Singapore, but Queen Elizabeth II's death still elicited grief and reflection in the Southeast Asian nation.

TITLE: Hungary can 'no longer be considered a full democracy,' says EU Parliament
SUMMARY: Hungary can "no longer be considered a full democracy," the European Parliament said in a statement following its adoption of a report on Thursday.
